blog.name: twinvax
blog.description: I write and reblog things for my fandoms. Main focus Critical Role. Feel free to send me asks or general headcanons about characters! I have a critical role rp blog! made and role played for Yeza the halfling (chemistyeza.tumblr.com). Asks open!

summary: Nott and the goblin corpse Caleb burned
question: Nott and the goblin corpse Caleb burned
answer:
Oh my god. 

Nott stared at the corpse, conflicted the same as the corpse was on if it wanted to be burned to a crisp or covered in flowers and vegetation. She didn’t know the goblin, had only seen it for a second alive before it was dead, but still felt sorry that it died. 

Of course, there was the fact it was in a creepy evil building, with rifts and monsters, and was in a literal pit of bones. It was likely an evil goblin, one that shouldn’t have been trusted when it was alive. The same as most other goblins she had met before. None were as bad as the ones who had killed her, but she still hadn’t trusted them. 

She probably wouldn’t have liked this one either. Even as she finds a good place for it to lie dead in this bone pit. 

She noticed the twinkling light below the bones, as she’s was putting the body in a good spot of the pit, and immediately started digging through to get to whatever the light is. 

Nott throws the corpse aside, uncaring of where it lands or wherever and whatever it had been doing before it had been burned, and digs out her prize. 

She doesn’t care about some goblins corpse, when she can find the thing causing a rift and fix the problem at hand.

blog.name: littleboatfullofwater
blog.title: Just me
blog.description:
Stephanie, twenty-mumbledy, female queer from Germany, chaotic dumbass. Beginning dice hoarder. You'll probably see a mix of puppies, kittens, different fandoms (mostly critical role rn), and feminist rants on this blog. And a lot of yelling in the tags.  
Stay if that's something for you ~

tags: I was honestl 100% sure it was the start of an abyssal invasion until I started writing this post
summary: so these discs are either
title: so these discs are either
body:
1. Planted by someone from the Dwendalian Empire to destabilize the Dynasty during the war. “Someone” being: a) Cerberus Assembly b) Cobalt Soul??? c) King Dwendal’s people?

2. Planted by someone from the Abyss to invade Xhorhas (possibly right now Because they are distracted by the War with the Empire) which could be related to: a) the devil?demon?? from yasha’s vision? b) Betrayer Gods??? c)??????

3. that dude they fought when they first arrived in xhorhas, the one who told the Bright Queen they were from the Empire, I can’t tell you why but I find him SUSPICIOUS a) from the moment he first held that first disc I was like HE BUILT IT which I have b) no proof for but he’s sketchy. c) does he have a name?? SEE, SUSPICIOUS.

4. Also, Essik. he has things to hide. under his weird mantel and drapery. which I THINK was blue.

5.?? ??????? ?? ??? ????? ???? ?? ?????????

blog.description: An artist and illustrator based out of CO. I have been working in the freelance art field for over 10 years, and specialize in fun and colorful illustrations for all ages. This site contains illustrations, sketches, store promotions, product development, and the occasional convention report. I can be contacted directly at ian@cometkins.com, or via the ask box.

blog.description: I write and reblog things for my fandoms. Main focus Critical Role. Feel free to send me asks or general headcanons about characters! I have a critical role rp blog! made and role played for Yeza the halfling (chemistyeza.tumblr.com). Asks open!

summary: Yasha and Nott make flower crowns together and talk about their respective weddings? <3
question: Yasha and Nott make flower crowns together and talk about their respective weddings? <3
answer:
“I was married, once.” Yasha admits quietly, hands gently weaving the flower crown of beautiful purple flowers into Nott’s hair, where they sat in the little grove. 

Nott looks up from her own weaving, surprised, “You were? That’s nice.” she says, not asking for elaboration, able to hear the pain behind the words. 

Yasha nods, “It was.” she whispered, burying her fingers in hair and flowers, pausing in place as she stares into memory. 

Nott doesn’t move, or jostle Yasha’s hands away, only looks up carefully with just her eyes, “What was…your wedding like?” she asks. 

Yasha twitched, fingers leaving Nott’s hair after the flowers were completely braided in, running them lightly down her hair from the crown to where it ended just below her shoulders, contemplating quietly, “It was secret and quiet. Just me and Zuala, performing the simple ceremony ourselves. It was small, but special, something only for us.” she sighs, hands dropping away from Nott’s hair entirely to fold across her chest self consciously. 

Nott turns around, kneeling in the grass as she sits on her heels, looking up at her, “Me and Yeza didn’t have many friends to invite to ours, and my family wasn’t that great to me, so our wedding was sorta quiet too. We did it in his family’s presence, with a cleric from the village, but that was all. Small and special, enough for us, and a little quiet, but perfect enough for us.” she shares. 

Yasha smiles, leaning down silently to allow Nott to fix the flower crown into her own hair, and rests a hand on her shoulder after she straightened back up, smile sad and wistful, “I’m happy you found him again, and that he loves you. I hope, someday, I’ll find where she is buried. I’ll give her the flowers I’ve collected.”

Nott tilts her head, feeling the crown shift with her ear movements, “Like the flowers I gave you awhile ago?” 

She nods, “Those ones too. Flowers from me, that she was never able to see, and flowers you gave to me as well. I think she’ll love those too.” 

Nott looks touched, and looks down at the grass as she pulls it up in her claws, face darkening with a blush of a deeper green, “I hope she will. I’m sorry, about whatever happened to her.”

Yasha collects the pulled up blades of grass in her hands, sifting through them with a finger before letting them fall back into the dirt, “The tribe didn’t agree with it, when they found out. They were going to kill her, when I ran away. I didn’t mate with who my tribe chose, and I got her hurt because of it.” 

“Maybe… maybe she’s alive? You didn’t see her die, maybe they let her go!” Nott exclaims, optimistic, picking through more flowers to make a few more. 

She nods, picking up her own pile of flowers to construct a few for the rest of the group, “Maybe.” she says, quietly. 

They go back to weaving the flower crowns, more relaxed, quiet conversation floating between them every once and awhile as they work.

summary: Breathe Out Air, a playlist by elsu0654 on Spotify
title: Breathe Out Air, a playlist by elsu0654 on Spotify
description:
I made this a while ago but finally decided to post it. A playlist for two blue girls in love.

Accompanying fic: Breathe In Saltwater, Breathe Out Air

  1. Daydream in Blue by I Monster
  2. Beekeeper by Keaton Hensen
  3. Dog Days Are Over by Florence and the Machine
  4. Fickle Heart by Ira Wolf
  5. Tea With Cinnamon by Katzenjammer
  6. Gimmie Love by Carly Rae Jepsen
  7. Bloom - Bonus Track by The Paper Kites
  8. Lips & Hips by Lily & Madeleine
  9. Can’t Help The Way I Feel by Lily & Madeleine

Accompanying fic: Breathe In Saltwater, Breathe Out Air

  1. Daydream in Blue by I Monster
  2. Beekeeper by Keaton Hensen
  3. Dog Days Are Over by Florence and the Machine
  4. Fickle Heart by Ira Wolf
  5. Tea With Cinnamon by Katzenjammer
  6. Gimmie Love by Carly Rae Jepsen
  7. Bloom - Bonus Track by The Paper Kites
  8. Lips & Hips by Lily & Madeleine
  9. Can’t Help The Way I Feel by Lily & Madeleine

summary:
So Caleb accidentally killed a Goblin. 
But to be fair, when they started hearing sounds from the bone pit, everyone at the...
body:
So Caleb accidentally killed a Goblin.

But to be fair, when they started hearing sounds from the bone pit, everyone at the table assume it was a monster. Caduceus even said something along the lines of ”Good call.” and ”there are only evil things here.” Caleb stopped as soon as he saw what was there but it was too late.

I hope Caleb gets to show his regret. I’m fairly sure Cad won’t. He’s even more ruthlessly practical than Caleb is at times. Poor Nott is really stuck with assholes.

I wonder though. Did the goblin put the device in the pit? Would they have found it faster without killing it? Would the fire have been enough to destroy the device if Caleb didn’t stop the spell? There would have been no second Chasme, no need for Jester to use her higher spells.

blog.name: hazelcephalopod
blog.title: Another Side of the Mirror
blog.description:
This has mostly turned into a CR blog-thing... I tag Thursday show until around Tuesday.

Hello peoples of Tumblr! This is my blog, which I make no promise to keep up with. I'm a bisexual Autistic. Also have ADD. I like cephalopods, especially cuttlefish, and plants, and reading, and many other geeky things.

More random tidbit: feminist, somewhere in the left politically, and tired of the political landscape but still trying to care. Also a lapsed pagan, it sounds like nonsense but idk how else to describe it. More things- gluten free, and crochet, knitting, and others. Beware of my many random posts as well.

That is all for now!

Oh BTW I am bad at tagging things, trying to get better, but its a work in progress.

tags: i hope we see Keg again because she ad Jester would have interesting interactions imo
summary: CR
body:
CR

Just a little thing but I liked that at one point someone -Beau I think- compared the giant’s fortress home to Lorenzo’s place and Laura/Jester did the holding up signs bit. Which I remember Ashly/Keg doing that same bit, at some point. That was a nice call back. Not sure it was intentional or not but it was nice.

summary: With all the theorizing of who was trying to open the rifts and why, y'all remember Kylre the fiend? A nergaliids thats supposed...
body: With all the theorizing of who was trying to open the rifts and why, y'all remember Kylre the fiend? A nergaliids thats supposed to hail from east Xorhas. Additionally, remember the Gnolls (which worship a demon lord) that don’t normally leave the hills? And now Yasha feelins like she remembers a humanoid man with horns and wings. I think the Abyssal problem is going to be a lot deeper than the war itself. I wouldn’t be surprised if the war is a side effect of the demon problem.

summary: More of the “Gilmore adopts Vax and Vex” AU. First time meeting Syldor.[[MORE]] The twins, of course, stop dead in their tracks...
body:
More of the “Gilmore adopts Vax and Vex” AU. First time meeting Syldor.

The twins, of course, stop dead in their tracks as soon they see him, their squabble from just a second earlier immediately forgotten. 

Neither of them knows who the other is, the first time they meet. Syldor is simply another customer and Gilmore another shop keeper in another town that he got assigned to in his role as a ambassador. They talk for a while, a professional but pleasent conversation about the books at the shop, since Syldor’s looking to expand his home library. 

They are interrupted by loud bickering as the door swings open and the twins waltz in, neither noticing nor caring that Gilmore is busy with a customer. As he calls them out on it, asking them to take their squabble somewhere else, that’s when they take notice. And so does Syldor. 

There they are, the children, now apparently teenagers, who ran away from him, his city, and everything he stands for. A couple of years ago now, but seeing them now he can feel his anger bubbling up again. He’d tried to find them, for a while at least, and to just run into them here, it almost seems like the universe itself wants to spite him. 

Shaun notices that the twins suddenly grow still, their fighting completely forgotten, and as they move a little bit closer to each other he can see a flicker of fear across their faces. His gaze moves from his adopted children to his customer, and suddenly he wonders how he hadn’t noticed the similiarities before. With cold dread crawling up his spine, he notices that this man must be their father. Biological, anyway. 

Before any of the other parties can speak he clears his throat, at least succeeding in getting everyone’s attention again. 

“Now, I think we are quite done here. It appears I have something else to attend to, if you don’t mind,” he says, giving Syldor his widest customer service smile, while at the same time making it clear that the conversation is done. He walks over to the twins, wrapping his arms around both their (still too small, even if they nearly reach his neck now) shoulders. They are gently dragged back by him until the door way is free, another clue for Syldor that he is not welcome anymore.

And he gets the hint, clearly, doesn’t mean he’s happy about it though. The look he gives them on his way out, but even more so the comment that he will be back (a bit too threatening in Shaun’s opinion), make him worry. But he can’t let the twins see that, so for now he calmly closes up the shop and usheres them both back into their living quarters. 

They are both visibly shaken, and only now does he realize that they don’t know  that this was a coincidence. For all they know, Syldor could have found them on their own, or Gilmore could have found him and invited him in. 

Not that either of them ever told him the man’s name, he still doesn’t know it, but they did tell him the city they came from and that their father was an asshole of relative importance. He just has to make sure they believe him, that he had no idea who he was talking to. 

It definitely shakes things up, but he still feels like they come out of it stronger. The twins actually talk about their past now, a little bit, about how they were taken from their mother and how living with their father was unbearable. About the disdain and the abuse they were subjected to in the elven city, and how they had eventually made their plan to escape. 

Vax reacts the strongest at first, at least outwardly, and it’s hard to raign him in again. They talk a lot, and while Vax wears his heart on his sleeve (how he will survive in this world one day is a mystery to Gilmore, the boy has too much love to give and not enough people he trusts), he can also be incredible stubborn about not talking about any of it when he wants to. When he does, it tends to become too much. It’s a slow process, but he seems to realize eventually that the man who has taken care of them for three years now is not going to let them go so easily. 

Vex, on the other hand, likes to pretend like nothing’s wrong at first. She goes about business as always, not as brooding as her brother, but she grows quiet. Very quiet. Spending more time with Trinket in the woods or clinging to her brother, like she’s always waiting for the other show to drop. She sleeps uneasy, he knows that, and while nightmares are not uncommon for both of his children, he knows that it’s gotten worse for her. 

All of it seems to come to a head for her one day, or rather night, when she knocks at his door far after midnight with tears streaming down her face and the timid question if they can talk. 

He learns a lot that night, not neccissarily about Syldor, but about her. He’s not even sure why this came up now, but he’s nonetheless glad that she came to him to talk about it. And it seems to change something in their relationship, for the better, because she trusted him with something she has never told anyone else, and trusts him to keep it between the two of them. 

And if she feels a little lighter after that, a little bit happier, that’s all he could ever ask for. 

It takes a while before Syldor, a name he now knows, comes back. There are no guards with him though, no lawyers or anyone else who could force him to give up his children. 

That doesn’t neccissarily mean that Syldor doesn’t want them back, but Gilmore realizes quickly that he’s not as forceful about it as he could be. The way the man all but haggles about his own flesh and blood is appaling, quite frankly, and if Gilmore didn’t have his own interest to take care of in this deal (and gods does he hate this word when it’s applied to Vax and Vex) he would berate him for his behaviour. 

The compromise they reach is easier, a lot easier than either had hoped, most likely. They stay where they are, and Syldor can rid himself of any and all responsibilites. 

Technically, Gilmore had already signed them up as his own, but they both know that this will only be efective in Emon. On paper, they now have family ties there as well as back in Syngorn. It’s one of the points the shop keeper insisted on. Should they ever feel the need to return to the elven city, for whatever reason, he doesn’t want their stand to be even worse than it already is. 

One thing that he had to give up in the compromise, in return, is the knowledge that Syldor has another family now. That the twins have another sister and, even they would probably not care much about that, a step mother. He wants to tell them, thinks that they deserve to know, but Syldor, for whatever reason, is not willing to give them that. Then again, maybe Gilmore shouldn’t be surprised that he’s trying to keep his “pure blood” daughter (it tastes like ash, even when he doesn’t speak these words out loud) as far away from his other children as possible. Once the twins do find out about it, and he’s sure they will, he’s prepared to be resented for keeping it from them. For now, the deal seems worth it. 

Once the negotiations between the two men are over, Gilmore is sure that he hasn’t felt such hatred for someone else in a long time. But at least his kids are save, and he will be able to keep them close. At least they weren’t the ones who had to deal with this. He doesn’t tell them about the whole process, only assures them that their father won’t come back. And in a city as big as Emon, he hopes that’s enough to keep them away from him.

But he can’t let the twins see that, so for now he calmly closes up the shop and usheres them both back into their living quarters. 

They are both visibly shaken, and only now does he realize that they don’t know  that this was a coincidence. For all they know, Syldor could have found them on their own, or Gilmore could have found him and invited him in. 

Not that either of them ever told him the man’s name, he still doesn’t know it, but they did tell him the city they came from and that their father was an asshole of relative importance. He just has to make sure they believe him, that he had no idea who he was talking to. 

It definitely shakes things up, but he still feels like they come out of it stronger. The twins actually talk about their past now, a little bit, about how they were taken from their mother and how living with their father was unbearable. About the disdain and the abuse they were subjected to in the elven city, and how they had eventually made their plan to escape. 

Vax reacts the strongest at first, at least outwardly, and it’s hard to raign him in again. They talk a lot, and while Vax wears his heart on his sleeve (how he will survive in this world one day is a mystery to Gilmore, the boy has too much love to give and not enough people he trusts), he can also be incredible stubborn about not talking about any of it when he wants to. When he does, it tends to become too much. It’s a slow process, but he seems to realize eventually that the man who has taken care of them for three years now is not going to let them go so easily. 

Vex, on the other hand, likes to pretend like nothing’s wrong at first. She goes about business as always, not as brooding as her brother, but she grows quiet. Very quiet. Spending more time with Trinket in the woods or clinging to her brother, like she’s always waiting for the other show to drop. She sleeps uneasy, he knows that, and while nightmares are not uncommon for both of his children, he knows that it’s gotten worse for her. 

All of it seems to come to a head for her one day, or rather night, when she knocks at his door far after midnight with tears streaming down her face and the timid question if they can talk. 

He learns a lot that night, not neccissarily about Syldor, but about her. He’s not even sure why this came up now, but he’s nonetheless glad that she came to him to talk about it. And it seems to change something in their relationship, for the better, because she trusted him with something she has never told anyone else, and trusts him to keep it between the two of them. 

And if she feels a little lighter after that, a little bit happier, that’s all he could ever ask for. 

It takes a while before Syldor, a name he now knows, comes back. There are no guards with him though, no lawyers or anyone else who could force him to give up his children. 

That doesn’t neccissarily mean that Syldor doesn’t want them back, but Gilmore realizes quickly that he’s not as forceful about it as he could be. The way the man all but haggles about his own flesh and blood is appaling, quite frankly, and if Gilmore didn’t have his own interest to take care of in this deal (and gods does he hate this word when it’s applied to Vax and Vex) he would berate him for his behaviour. 

The compromise they reach is easier, a lot easier than either had hoped, most likely. They stay where they are, and Syldor can rid himself of any and all responsibilites. 

Technically, Gilmore had already signed them up as his own, but they both know that this will only be efective in Emon. On paper, they now have family ties there as well as back in Syngorn. It’s one of the points the shop keeper insisted on. Should they ever feel the need to return to the elven city, for whatever reason, he doesn’t want their stand to be even worse than it already is. 

One thing that he had to give up in the compromise, in return, is the knowledge that Syldor has another family now. That the twins have another sister and, even they would probably not care much about that, a step mother. He wants to tell them, thinks that they deserve to know, but Syldor, for whatever reason, is not willing to give them that. Then again, maybe Gilmore shouldn’t be surprised that he’s trying to keep his “pure blood” daughter (it tastes like ash, even when he doesn’t speak these words out loud) as far away from his other children as possible. Once the twins do find out about it, and he’s sure they will, he’s prepared to be resented for keeping it from them. For now, the deal seems worth it. 

Once the negotiations between the two men are over, Gilmore is sure that he hasn’t felt such hatred for someone else in a long time. But at least his kids are save, and he will be able to keep them close. At least they weren’t the ones who had to deal with this. He doesn’t tell them about the whole process, only assures them that their father won’t come back. And in a city as big as Emon, he hopes that’s enough to keep them away from him.
trail.content:
More of the “Gilmore adopts Vax and Vex” AU. First time meeting Syldor.

The twins, of course, stop dead in their tracks as soon they see him, their squabble from just a second earlier immediately forgotten. 

Neither of them knows who the other is, the first time they meet. Syldor is simply another customer and Gilmore another shop keeper in another town that he got assigned to in his role as a ambassador. They talk for a while, a professional but pleasent conversation about the books at the shop, since Syldor’s looking to expand his home library. 

They are interrupted by loud bickering as the door swings open and the twins waltz in, neither noticing nor caring that Gilmore is busy with a customer. As he calls them out on it, asking them to take their squabble somewhere else, that’s when they take notice. And so does Syldor. 

There they are, the children, now apparently teenagers, who ran away from him, his city, and everything he stands for. A couple of years ago now, but seeing them now he can feel his anger bubbling up again. He’d tried to find them, for a while at least, and to just run into them here, it almost seems like the universe itself wants to spite him. 

Shaun notices that the twins suddenly grow still, their fighting completely forgotten, and as they move a little bit closer to each other he can see a flicker of fear across their faces. His gaze moves from his adopted children to his customer, and suddenly he wonders how he hadn’t noticed the similiarities before. With cold dread crawling up his spine, he notices that this man must be their father. Biological, anyway. 

Before any of the other parties can speak he clears his throat, at least succeeding in getting everyone’s attention again. 

“Now, I think we are quite done here. It appears I have something else to attend to, if you don’t mind,” he says, giving Syldor his widest customer service smile, while at the same time making it clear that the conversation is done. He walks over to the twins, wrapping his arms around both their (still too small, even if they nearly reach his neck now) shoulders. They are gently dragged back by him until the door way is free, another clue for Syldor that he is not welcome anymore.

And he gets the hint, clearly, doesn’t mean he’s happy about it though. The look he gives them on his way out, but even more so the comment that he will be back (a bit too threatening in Shaun’s opinion), make him worry. But he can’t let the twins see that, so for now he calmly closes up the shop and usheres them both back into their living quarters. 

They are both visibly shaken, and only now does he realize that they don’t know  that this was a coincidence. For all they know, Syldor could have found them on their own, or Gilmore could have found him and invited him in. 

Not that either of them ever told him the man’s name, he still doesn’t know it, but they did tell him the city they came from and that their father was an asshole of relative importance. He just has to make sure they believe him, that he had no idea who he was talking to. 

It definitely shakes things up, but he still feels like they come out of it stronger. The twins actually talk about their past now, a little bit, about how they were taken from their mother and how living with their father was unbearable. About the disdain and the abuse they were subjected to in the elven city, and how they had eventually made their plan to escape. 

Vax reacts the strongest at first, at least outwardly, and it’s hard to raign him in again. They talk a lot, and while Vax wears his heart on his sleeve (how he will survive in this world one day is a mystery to Gilmore, the boy has too much love to give and not enough people he trusts), he can also be incredible stubborn about not talking about any of it when he wants to. When he does, it tends to become too much. It’s a slow process, but he seems to realize eventually that the man who has taken care of them for three years now is not going to let them go so easily. 

Vex, on the other hand, likes to pretend like nothing’s wrong at first. She goes about business as always, not as brooding as her brother, but she grows quiet. Very quiet. Spending more time with Trinket in the woods or clinging to her brother, like she’s always waiting for the other show to drop. She sleeps uneasy, he knows that, and while nightmares are not uncommon for both of his children, he knows that it’s gotten worse for her. 

All of it seems to come to a head for her one day, or rather night, when she knocks at his door far after midnight with tears streaming down her face and the timid question if they can talk. 

He learns a lot that night, not neccissarily about Syldor, but about her. He’s not even sure why this came up now, but he’s nonetheless glad that she came to him to talk about it. And it seems to change something in their relationship, for the better, because she trusted him with something she has never told anyone else, and trusts him to keep it between the two of them. 

And if she feels a little lighter after that, a little bit happier, that’s all he could ever ask for. 

It takes a while before Syldor, a name he now knows, comes back. There are no guards with him though, no lawyers or anyone else who could force him to give up his children. 

That doesn’t neccissarily mean that Syldor doesn’t want them back, but Gilmore realizes quickly that he’s not as forceful about it as he could be. The way the man all but haggles about his own flesh and blood is appaling, quite frankly, and if Gilmore didn’t have his own interest to take care of in this deal (and gods does he hate this word when it’s applied to Vax and Vex) he would berate him for his behaviour. 

The compromise they reach is easier, a lot easier than either had hoped, most likely. They stay where they are, and Syldor can rid himself of any and all responsibilites. 

Technically, Gilmore had already signed them up as his own, but they both know that this will only be efective in Emon. On paper, they now have family ties there as well as back in Syngorn. It’s one of the points the shop keeper insisted on. Should they ever feel the need to return to the elven city, for whatever reason, he doesn’t want their stand to be even worse than it already is. 

One thing that he had to give up in the compromise, in return, is the knowledge that Syldor has another family now. That the twins have another sister and, even they would probably not care much about that, a step mother. He wants to tell them, thinks that they deserve to know, but Syldor, for whatever reason, is not willing to give them that. Then again, maybe Gilmore shouldn’t be surprised that he’s trying to keep his “pure blood” daughter (it tastes like ash, even when he doesn’t speak these words out loud) as far away from his other children as possible. Once the twins do find out about it, and he’s sure they will, he’s prepared to be resented for keeping it from them. For now, the deal seems worth it. 

Once the negotiations between the two men are over, Gilmore is sure that he hasn’t felt such hatred for someone else in a long time. But at least his kids are save, and he will be able to keep them close. At least they weren’t the ones who had to deal with this. He doesn’t tell them about the whole process, only assures them that their father won’t come back. And in a city as big as Emon, he hopes that’s enough to keep them away from him.
trail.content_abstract: More of the “Gilmore adopts Vax and Vex” AU. First time meeting Syldor.
